title: Possible denial of service when entering a loooong password

profile.name: Nextcloud
profile.about: Access, share and protect your files, calendars, contacts, communication & more at home and in your enterprise.

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us!

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster. For obvious reasons we'd like to ask you to not disclose this issue to any other party.
Yeah sorry, it has been passed on to the respective developers now.
hope your team make quick response.
Hi @xch_eater0 we're testing a fix currently, and will keep you posted about the further process..

Hi @xch_eater0,

We have a small fix for the app that limtes the input to 100 chars.
That should help with the biggest issues.

Cheers,
--Roeland
Thts good step, so waiting for your fixes.

The patch has been merged https://github.com/nextcloud/preferred_providers/pull/16
We are currently waiting for the maintainer to put a new release in the app store

Thanks a lot for your report again. This has been resolved in our latest maintenance releases and we're working on the advisories at the moment.

Please let us know how you'd like to be credited in our official advisory. We require the following information:

- Name / Pseudonym
- Email address (optional)
- Website (optional)
- Company (optional)
Sorry I just forgot to close the issue. The update is available since two weeks already

additional_data.old_title: The password limit is not set, [DoS].
additional_data.new_title: Possible denial of service when entering a loooong password

activities.message:
Advisory will be pusblished at https://nextcloud.com/security/advisory/?id=NC-SA-2020-028
CVE pending: CVE-2020-8202
The release was on 16th June, + 4 weeks makes 14th July, so tomorrow.
yes sir you can  disclose  and thanks for bounty
